elements.text: PETER DAVISON Time and space traveller.
JANET FIELDING Waylaid air stewardess.
LOUISE JAMESON Formerly of the Sevateem, now of Gallifrey.
Earnest Gallifreyan bureaucrat. Frazzled by the demands of her job, often terse.
Astute Gallifreyan political player. Very slick, sharp and charismatic.
Gallifreyan current affairs broadcaster.
(3, 4)/ ULLNER (1)/ CARTH (2): Gallifreyan architect and Academy professor./ Immigration official./ Acadan warrior.
(1)/ KESNELL (4): Agent of covert policy bureau./ Senior member of the High Council.
(2)/ SCANDRIUS (3): Oxilan warrior./ Young, impetuous, incompetent Gallifreyan.
(2)/ INEC (2)/ FEGAX (3): A representative of a godlike race called the Arimcei./ His brother./ Gallifreyan student protestor.
ASSEMBLED TIME LORDS (1); GUARD CAPTAIN (2).
HELEN GOLDWYN
ALAN BARNES
DAVID RICHARDSON
NICHOLAS BRIGGS & JASON HAIGH-ELLERY
FINISH PRODUCTIONS LTD © 2017
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 2
1: Period of Adjustment
GRAMS DOCTOR WHO THEME
SCENE 1. GALLIFREYAN STUDIO
F/X CURRENT AFFAIRS BROADCAST STYLE. STATELY MUSIC.
ARCANTIS, THE PRESENTER (40s, ARROGANT, PUGNATIOUS), SPEAKS TO COUNCILLOR VORENA (40S/50S, VERY SLICK, SHARP AND CHARISMATIC).
Welcome back. I’m joined now by Councillor Vorena, newly appointed to the High Council —
Thank you for having me on the programme, Arcantis.
Always a pleasure. Now — a lot of people, including some very senior Time Lords, are asking how long we can tolerate the power vacuum at the summit of Gallifreyan society.
I know this is the question on everyone’s mind, [and —]
F/X CASTELLAN LOWRI (20S/30S, EARNEST, FRAZZLED BY THE
DEMANDS OF HER JOB, OFTEN TERSE), INTERRUPTS HER.
It’s not a vacuum, strictly speaking?
Castellan Lowri, who also joins us today, has some thoughts on this issue.
We do have an Acting President, who [has —]
Who has served more than twice as long any previous Acting President —
Please, Arcantis — could I finish?
Who has no mandate, and lower approval figures than any of the past seventeen presidents.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 3
The present situation is constitutionally delicate, we’re consulting on the system of succession and President Tavoli —
Over-Chancellor Tavoli, she doesn’t get the title until she faces election.
— is doing a very good job of tidying up the mess left by President Borusa.
Chancellor, how do you feel about the Castellan’s words there? You paid tribute to Borusa after his disappearance — he is still a very popular figure among ordinary Gallifreyans.
I sense you’re trying to manufacture conflict between Lowri and myself. Look — we’re not here to talk about Borusa.
Although he let an awful lot of government business slide and quietly introduced a lot of unwelcome legislation which we are still trying to dismantle.
This sounds like prevarication on behalf of a career politician who has ascended to the Presidency by default —
Which, incidentally, seems the only way we’re likely to get a female President these days.

I have nothing whatsoever against women, I was one myself a couple of regenerations ago. But a lot of people feel this has been a backdoor promotion of someone who is out of touch with ordinary Gallifreyans and has no experience of anything outside the Capitol bubble.
That is completely unfair.
Look — I have a lot of respect for Over-Chancellor Tavoli. But it’s time for change, and there’s only one candidate.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2. INT. TARDIS
F/X USUAL TARDIS BACKGROUND HUM. DOCTOR IS TAKING OFF.
Right! Back to Frontios.
I knew you were going to say that.
Then I didn’t disappoint you, did I, Tegan.
No, no, you did. Doctor — are you sure the Gravis won’t manage get off that planet?
No-one’s likely to drop by a junk planet around a dying star. The Gravis can spend the rest of its days dragging detritus into bundles without [ever -]
F/X BEEP FROM CONSOLE.
What was that?
A message. Emergency frequency.
F/X DOCTOR WORKS AT CONTROLS, THEN — LEELA APPEARS IN THE
TARDIS, AS A HOLOGRAPHIC PROJECTION.
(D) Doctor?
Leela?
(D) Is that you?
Yes yes, it’s me.
Who’s Leela, and how did she get in the TARDIS?
(D) I am not really here — this is just a projection.
Is this an emergency, or did you just fancy a chat?
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 5
(D) It is a dire emergency.
Oh. I was hoping for a chat.
What sort of emergency?
(TO LEELA) Sorry — this is Tegan.
(D) Doctor - the Time Lords have found you.
I knew this would happen. I knew — if we went too far into the future —
(D) They are using a Vortex Manipulator to bring your TARDIS back to Gallifrey.
What does a Vortex Manipulator do?
(D) It manipulates the vortex.
Well that’s easily avoided.
F/X DOCTOR WORKS QUICKLY AT CONTROLS.
Why are they bringing him back?
Probably to tell me off for interfering in a time period they’ve identified [as —]
(D) No — they say you accepted an offer to become President?
Oh, good grief.
(D) Is it true?
Yes.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 6
I only accepted so I could get them off my back while I slipped away — of course I don’t want to be President.
Are you a Time Lord? Lady? Whatever?
(D) No.
Leela’s from a lost human colony on a distant jungle planet, but she lives on Gallifrey now.
Wow. And I thought coming to England was a big move.
F/X DOCTOR’S STILL WORKING AT CONSOLE.
Who tipped you off that they were coming to get me?
(D) Oh, it is well known. There is to be a —
F/X TARDIS MAKES A WRENCHING NOISE. LEELA VANISHES.
Aha!
You’ve done it?
Yes — looped the TARDIS through a parallel dimension where time runs in the opposite direction. They’1l never trace us now.
Hey, she’s gone.
So she has. I so rarely get to see old friends.
F/X TARDIS LANDS.
Have we landed?
Yes. Let’s grab Turlough and get out of here.
F/X DOCTOR OPENS THE DOOR, HEADS TOWARDS IT. INTO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 3. CAPITOL LANDING BAY [CONTINUOUS]
F/X DOCTOR AND TEGAN STEP OUT.
Doctor? Are you sure this is —
F/X MASSIVE FANFARE. OVER PA:
(D) Welcome back to the Lord President-elect of Gallifrey — the Doctor!
TIME LORDS
RAPTUROUS APPLAUSE
Oh.
(LOW) ‘They’1ll never trace us now’.
(LOW) Maybe I went via the wrong parallel dimension.
(LOW) What do we do now?
(LOW) Smile and wave.
F/X LOWRI COMES OVER, A LITTLE NERVOUS BEFORE CROWD.
Lord President, it is an honour and a privilege and (BEAT) an honour to welcome you back to your homeworld of Gallifrey as its rightful leader.
And you are...?
Castellan Lowri, your excellency.
Excellent. I just need to pop into my TARDIS and grab a few things and I’1l be right with you. Tegan?
Righto.
F/X DOCTOR AND TEGAN TURN TO WALK AWAY.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 8
It might interest you to know that this landing bay has a dampening field that makes it impossible for any TARDIS to take off.
Oh.
If you’d like to walk with me?
Come on, Tegan.
Not her.
What?
F/X GUARD CAPTAINS ARE MARCHING OVER TO TEGAN.
There are a few formalities to be completed — the Chancellery Guard will escort you.
F/X TEGAN MARCHED AWAY BY GUARD CAPTAINS.
(OFF) Hey! She said ‘escort’, not drag me off by the shoulders!
(TO LOWRI) Is this necessary?
It’s just procedure.
(CALLS) Don’t worry, Tegan!
(OFF) I’m not worried, I’m angry!
(CALLS) Good.
Can we speak in the council chambers, your excellency?
All right.
F/X ARCANTIS SPEAKS OVER THE PA AGAIN.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 9
(D) The dignity and poise — such a natural Presidential air. The Doctor, everyone.
F/X APPLAUSE RISES AGAIN.
Did you have to invite all these people?
It wasn’t my idea.
F/X DOOR CLOSES BEHIND THEM. INTO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 4. INT. CAPITOL CORRIDOR [CONTINUOUS]
F/X DOCTOR AND LOWRI STRIDE ALONG.
You wanted to make it more difficult for me to duck out, didn’t you? In front of a great big crowd like that.
I told you, it wasn’t my idea.
That sort of sleight-of-hand is worthy of your late predecessor, Castellan — um — You know, I don’t think I ever caught his name.
The official story is that you were unavoidably detained tying up other business before you could take up the Presidency.
F/X THEY WALK PAST VORENA.
Welcome back, your excellency.
Thank you...
Chancellor Vorena. I’m a great admirer of yours.
(PLEASED) Oh.
I thought you might like some help with your inaugural address?
I don’t think that will be necessary — excuse us.
F/X DOORS OPEN AS DOCTOR AND LOWRI WALK OFF.
This is all moving rather fast, isn’t it?
It needs to.
F/X THEY WALK THROUGH THE DOORS. INTO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 5. INT. COUNCIL CHAMBERS [CONTINUOUS]
F/X DOORS CLOSE BEHIND THEM.
So, we think you should present yourself as —
Lowri, I like to think I’m an amenable sort of chap, especially compared with some of my recent incarnations, but even so I have no interest in being told what to do by the High Council.
Right.
I don’t want to be President, and frankly I’m rather good at escaping from things.
I see.
And furthermore, my appointment by so-called “emergency powers” was unconstitutional. No successor was named, hence an election should have been held, which I do not intend to contest.
(SIGHS) They told me you’d be like this.
Who’s ‘they’?
I don’t have a list to hand, but there were quite a few of them. Chancellor Flavia told the public you were indeed named by Borusa as his successor, so you [are —]
Where is Flavia? Let me talk to her.
She retired.
Why?
Because people blamed her for bungling the succession.
Well, they’re not far wrong. The idea I’m the rightful President is a complete fiction! No. I won’t do it.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 12
We’ve announced it all now — you have [to —]
F/X CALL COMES THROUGH FOR LOWRI — SHE ANSWERS IT.
Hello?
(D) When are you going to be done, Lowri?
Depends how long it takes me to convince the Doctor to do it at all.
(D) What?
You can’t make me.
(D) Send him to me.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 6. INT. DETENTION AREA
F/X TEGAN SITS ALONE, BEHIND A CONTAINMENT BARRIER. LEELA
APPROACHES.
Tegan?
Leela! I thought everyone had forgotten about me.
One moment. (CALLS) Guards! Lower the containment barrier. (BEAT) I said lower it. If she tries to escape I will kill her myself.
F/X CONTAINMENT BARRIER VANISHES.
That is better.
(NERVOUS) Yeah.
(LOW) I will not really kill you. I just wanted them to do as I said.
(LOW; STILL UNEASY) Good.
(LOW) But please do not try to escape, or I will look foolish.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 7. PRESIDENT’S OFFICE
F/X GENTLE SOUND OF RUNNING, DRIPPING WATER.
I like the water feature, Vorena.
Your predecessor put it there. Doctor, I [appreciate —]
What used to be here?
The Harp of Rassilon.
Oh yes! So is this the Water Feature of Rassilon?
Stop changing the subject, Doctor.
All right. It’s obvious the whole idea is to keep me on a short leash. Make me think I’m in charge, but keep me tied up in bureaucracy so I’m not out in the universe embarrassing them.
(SIGHS) That is how some of the High Council view your appointment.
Of course [they —]
But I lobbied for you to be brought back as President.
Why?
Because Gallifrey is in trouble. We haven’t told the public what Borusa did, with the timescoop and the Death Zone [and —]
Why not?
Because we'd have to explain how we let it happen. And Borusa steered us through some major crises, don’t forget.
He had a little help.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 15
But his reputation — it’s hard to fight that.
I suppose. Like trying to convince people Churchill had turned into Hitler.
What had turned into who?
Why does it have to be me who replaces him?

Borusa quietly laid the groundwork for himself to take absolute power. He undermined and discredited the High Council, he appointed weak people to office to make sure nobody was around to challenge him, and he left us in a constitutional mess.
Still, it’s hardly my [usual —]
He deliberately created a system only he could hold together. Without him, parts of Gallifrey are talking about becoming independent states, no longer under the High Council’s rule.
But that would be disastrous! The wars we used to have before unification — the whole galaxy could be affected if we had another.
We need a candidate from outside the Capitol to restore trust — a big personality. There aren’t a lot of those in Gallifreyan politics these days, but you [do —]
All right! As an interim measure. We start looking for my successor immediately.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 8. INT. DETENTION AREA
F/X TEGAN’S STILL TALKIING TO LEELA.
They tell me your application to enter Gallifrey is being considered.
I spoke to someone who kept asking questions like had I been inoculated against diseases I’d never heard of, had I ever participated in illegal time experiments —
You told them no?
Of course, but then he asked if I’d ever participated in the overthrow of any planetary ruler or system of government...
Oh.
I mean, you travel around with the Doctor, it happens from time to time! Then they slung me in here with this computer-book thing and told me to read it.
What is it about?
They want me to take an exam about Gallifreyan history and culture.
F/X BLEEP FROM AN ELECTRONIC BOOK.
It’s so confusing. Did Omega come after Rassilon or were they
at the same time?
Would you like me to help?
Yes please.
F/X LEELA TAKES THE E-BOOK FROM TEGAN.
So. What is the maximum number of regenerations a Time Lord can have?
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 17
Ah — now, I’m pretty sure this is a trick question.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL)
SCENE 9. PRESIDENT’S OFFICE
F/X AS BEFORE.
First you’ll be introduced.
Right.
Using your full name.
Out of the question.
You can’t be called ‘President Doctor’.
Why not?
It’s two titles.
Page 18
They call people ‘Lord President’, that’s two titles.
‘Lord President Doctor’ sounds even more absurd.
Having me as President is absurd, so that seems fitting.
Let’s get you measured for your robes of office.
Oh no — I’m not wearing the robes.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 10. INT. HOLDING CELL
F/X LEELA IS STILL HELPING TEGAN CRAM FOR HER TEST.
‘True or false: a Time Lord is born with two hearts.’
Oh! I know this one. False, they develop the second after the first regeneration. — Don’t they?
F/X AN IMMIGRATION OFFICIAL, ULLNER, ENTERS.
You are... (PRONOUNCES THIS WRONG) ‘Tegg-anne Jovv-anne-ka’?
Tegan Jovanka.
That’s what I said. My name is Ullner, and I’m here to tell you your application for Gallifreyan residency has been rejected.
But she has not done the test yet.
You failed the background check.
So what’1l happen to me?
Don’t worry — we're just going to wipe your memory of everything that’s happened since you met the Doctor and return you to Earth.
You can’t do that!
Standard procedure I’m afraid.
You must tell the Doctor — the President — about this.
He’s in the Panopticon, giving his inaugural address.
You mean we’re missing it?
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 20
You’re not the only one. I never miss an inauguration, but thanks to [you —]
Put it on the screen!
Don’t take that tone with me.
Please, could you put it on the screen.
All right.
F/X ULLNER WAVES A HAND ACROSS THE SCREEN, IT SPRINGS
INTO LIFE. DOCTOR IS GIVING HIS SPEECH, WITHOUT MUCH ENTHUSIASM.
(D) It is of course an honour to be welcomed into the role of President...
F/X CROSS TO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 11. INT. PANOPTICON [CONTINUOUS]
I was going to say, welcomed for the second time. But I’m told that my previous occupancy of the highest office on Gallifrey doesn’t count, and has been stricken from the record.
TIME LORDS (MURMURING) Really?/ Quite right, too!/ When was this?

It’s a source of great pride to my old chapter, the Prydonians, that they’ve supplied more Presidents than any other. However, my Prydonian privileges were revoked after I stole my TARDIS and left Gallifrey, so it’s a shame they cannot add me to their total.
TIME LORDS
(MURMURING — SOME DISGRUNTLED, SOME AMUSED) So who does he belong to?/ One in the eye for them!/ Typical Prydonian, no class whatsoever.

I attended the Academy, like you all. It was a decidedly mixed experience for me. Other institutions might have served me better — but only the Academy can confer the title of Time Lord. And that’s why my first act as President will be to allow other institutions to apply for Academy status.
TIME LORDS (CONSIDERABLE DISQUIET) He’s joking, isn’t he?/ I mean, he can’t!/ Utterly ridiculous!
The institution currently known as just the Academy will be renamed the Prydonian Academy, as it has been informally known for many years anyway, and...
TIME LORDS (LOUD DISQUIET) Total outrage! / Did the High Council know about this?
(REALISES HUBBUB MEANS NOBODY IS LISTENING) Fine, talk amongst yourselves.
F/X CROSS BACK TO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 12. INT. HOLDING CELL [CONTINUOUS]
F/X THE BROADCAST HAS DESCENDED INTO CHATTER. ARCANTIS
STARTS TO COMMENTATE OVER THE TOP.
(D) Gosh. Well, plenty of talking points there from what’s certainly the most eventful inaugural address we’ve had in several centuries, and we’ll be getting reaction to that —
F/X ULLNER TURNS OFF SCREEN.
He’s going to be a disaster. A disaster...
F/X ULLNER LEAVES.
I hope the Doctor hasn’t forgotten about me.
Of course he hasn’t. We’1l think of a way round this.
Did you have this problem when you came to live here?
No, it was much easier because — I have an excellent idea.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 13. INT. CORRIDOR
F/X DOCTOR STRIDES ALONG. LOWRI CATCHES UP TO HIM.
Lord President!
Ah, Castellan, my Castellan. How do you think that went?
You should have discussed any policy announcement with the High Counca:.
Everyone was looking bored so I thought I’d liven things up.
You can’t just create new academies!

It should have been done aeons ago. You said people are becoming disgruntled with the elite around here. Expanding the academy system to Gallifreyans from different backgrounds will create Time Lords with fresh outlooks.
But won’t it devalue the status of Time Lord if you have several institutions appointing their own?
Yes, probably. So you’1l all have to work a bit harder at becoming interesting and worthwhile people in your own right, won’t you?
(OFF) There you are, Doctor!
Leela! (TO LOWRI) Excuse me, I need to talk to my friend.
But we need clarification [on —]
F/X DOCTOR OPENS DOOR.
I’ll clarify everything for you later. (TO LEELA) Where’s
Tegan?
That is why I came. (THEY ENTER THE ROOM. INTO: )
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 14. INT. PRESIDENT’S CHAMBERS [CONTINUOUS]
F/X DOOR CLOSES BEHIND THEM.
I haven’t spoken to you properly since I arrived. It’s good to see you.
And you too.
I’m sorry — I’ve been back twice recently and wanted to catch up but, you know, things got in the way.
They always do, with you.
But you’re keeping well? How’s Andred?
He and K9 are away with a squad cleaning up the Death Zone. There are creatures still lurking in its darker recesses.
Did they find that Raston Warrior Robot?
No.
Oh dear.
I found it. A worthy opponent. I have its head mounted on the wall of my kitchen.
Of course you have. Did you see my speech?
Part of it —
Put the cat among the pigeons!
But there is a more urgent issue — they will not let Tegan stay.
I should have known they’d be tedious about this.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 25
They intend to erase her memory and send her back to Earth.
What? I’ll get the Castellan to lodge an appeal, she’1ll know how to do it all [properly —]
I have a much simpler idea that will solve everything.
Excellent.
You and Tegan could be married.
(BEAT) Right.
It is a very good idea, isn’t it.
I’m not sure I’d say very good.
But you do want her to stay?
Of course, it’s just... marriage?
It wouldn’t have to be a proper marriage.
It wouldn’t be a proper marriage.
Is there a problem?
F/X COMMS BLEEP. DOCTOR RESPONDS.
Excuse me, Leela, this looks urgent. (INTO COMMS) Yes, hello, Lord President of Gallifrey here.
(D) My name’s Crex, Lord President. I need to speak with you,
privately.
Certainly. Sorry, Leela, duty calls. You can see yourself out...?
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 26
MAKES DISGRUNTLEMENT NOISE AS SHE EXITS
F/X DOOR OPENS AND CLOSES BEHIND LEELA THROUGH:
(D) Lord President?
Crex, yes! The good news is you’ve just interrupted a conversation I didn’t want to have, so I’m already well disposed to whatever you have to say.
(D) Good! You must abandon your plan to create new Academies.
Right. Not that well disposed.
(D) You must.
I suppose you’re going to foretell doom if I suggest things should be done differently from how they’ve been done for millennia, are you?
(D) Lord President — I’m part of the High Council’s Policy Adjustment Bureau.
I’ve never heard of it.
(D) Only the President has access to our findings.
Findings?
(D) We travel back in time and prevent Presidents from taking decisions which have negative consequences.
Really.
(D) I’ve come from the near future of Gallifrey to advise you to drop this plan immediately — and no previous President has ever ignored our advice.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 16. INT. HOLDING CELL
F/X ULLNER ENTERS.
Time to go, Jov-anne-ka!
But what about the Doctor?
I sent a message up to the President, but I’ve heard nothing back.
He wouldn’t just leave me like this, without saying goodbye.
What difference does it make? You won’t remember him anyway, after this.
Please — give him a bit of time, I’m sure he’1ll come —
We have no time.
But you’re the Time Lords!
Your attitude is doing you no favours, you know. Do as I say or I’1ll make sure you forget more than just your time with the Doctor.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 17. INT. COUNCIL CHAMBERS
F/X DOCTOR MEETING WITH LOWRI AND VORENA.
How long has this Policy Adjustment Bureau existed, Castellan?
I’ve no idea. There’s nothing in the official records. Or the unofficial ones.
I’m President now, I need to know these things. Vorena? Did you know about this?

No. It’s not even mentioned in the Black Files, which officially unexist and which you can only read by visiting an office at the heart of an asteroid in a pocket dimension which is the only surviving remnant of a redundant timeline.
I’ve never seen those.
They’re nowhere near as exciting as you’d expect.
So the Policy Adjustment Bureau is so secret, only the President knows about it? It’s a disgrace! It means the President can appear almost infallible!
Also, it directly contravenes the Laws Of Time.
Of course, and you’d never catch me breaking those. (CLEARS
So what are you proposing?
I’m shutting down the Policy Adjustment Bureau with immediate effect.
F/X CREX APPEARS IN FRONT OF THEM WITH A TIME RING NOISE.
That’s a bad idea, Doctor.
Ah, I thought you might make an appearance.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 29
Who is this?
This, Lowri, is Crex from the P.A.B.
You look familiar.
I don’t think so.
Chancellor Vorena. Didn’t we go for dinner once?
You must be thinking of someone else.
I’m sure we did.
I’m trying to warn the President he’s making a dreadful mistake.
I’m not.
You were told not to inform anyone else of the existence of the P.A.B.
Yes. I ignored you. And now I’m getting rid of you.
The P.A.B. has protected Presidents for several generations —
From what? Themselves? Who are you to decide what’s a good or bad decision?
If you’d seen the future for yourself —
But that’s not allowed, is it?
Naturally the President himself cannot be seen to contravene the Laws of Time.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 30
So I just have to take your word for it? I cannot allow this kind of power to reside with a secretive autonomous body.
That’s a shame, Doctor.
F/X CREX PULLS A GUN.
Lord President — he’s armed!
He won’t shoot me, don’t worry.
No. I’ve got a better idea. I’m going to go back to before Borusa decided to play the Game Of Rassilon and warn him how it’ll end.
We can’t have Borusa back.
Too late.
You're right, it is too late. Because I suspected you’d use your facilities to try and stop me, and that’s why I gave my friend Leela a Time Ring —
What?
F/X TIME RING NOISE AS LEELA APPEARS BEHIND CREX.
Move and I will slit your throat.
(STARTLED) Aah!
Take his Time Ring, Leela.
No, you can’t!
(TO LEELA) Throw it here, please.
THROWING EFFORT
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 31
(CATCHING IT) Thank you. Crude compared to a TARDIS, but they are rather more stealthy than —
F/X CREX ELBOWS LEELA IN THE GUT.
(WINDED) Oof!
Don’t try to follow me — or I’11 shoot!
F/X RUNS FROM ROOM. INTO:
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 32
SCENE 18. INT. CAPITOL CORRIDOR [CONTINUOUS]
F/X CREX RUNS ALONG, RUNS INTO ARCANTIS.
Out of my way!
Don’t shoot! I only have two regenerations left!
Don’t I know you from [the —]
Vidcasts, yes, I [present —]
I need a TARDIS.
I left mine at home — honestly, the parking at the Capitol these days [is —]
Which way to the nearest landing bay?
Over there.
F/X CREX RUNS OFF.
#230: TIME IN OFFICE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 19. INT. LANDING BAY
F/X CREX RUNS IN, SLOWS.
Yes! Now...
